page.title: 14FACE ENTERPRISE SCHEME
page.content: The FACE unit occupies part of the old brewery in Wiveliscombe.The town was prosperous when dominated by Hancocks, later Arnold and Hancocks.This was taken over by Ushers in 1955,then by Watneys,resulting in the eventual closure in 1961.The site was then used for chicken processing.Taunton Vale Transport used the cider factory as a warehouse which spectacularly caught fire in 1969.The shell was later bulldozed and old peoples flats built. Those who felt that the passing of the brewery heralded the decline of Wiveliscombe are heartened by the two small establishments now brewing Exmoor and Cotleigh Ale. There are two other areas which have attracted small businesses and manufacturing industries.They offer sites of 1/4 to 1 acre,on flat land,with easy access to the A361
